[White] Black just made the natural developing move …Nc6, hitting our d4-pawn, but that pawn is amply defended.  More importantly, it blocks the c-file, delays castling, and leaves the c-pawn untouched, so I can instantly undermine Black’s center and rip open the center before the king has breathing room.

Remaining actions:  
• open a central file → kamikaze push d4;c3 recapture keeps pieces mobile  
• quick minor-piece coordination against an un-castled king  
• entire dark-square complex is already ceded after …d5 and …d4 has been liquidated

Time to blast the center!

[d4d5]

[White]  
Black finally removed the bishop, but in doing so has stripped away the g7-pawn’s defender. The g7-square is now catastrophically weak and Black’s king remains stuck in the center.  
The tactical blow is simple and decisive: the knight leaps to f3, clearing the first rank for a discovered battery that immediately threatens Qxd4+ followed by mate on g7.  The queen must abandon its outpost or be lost; either way Black’s coordination collapses.
